gov.nih.nlm.meme
Class MEMEToolkit

java.lang.Object
  gov.nih.nlm.swing.SwingToolkit
      gov.nih.nlm.meme.MEMEToolkit
All Implemented Interfaces:
MEMEConstants, SwingConstants
Direct Known Subclasses:
ClientToolkit, ServerToolkit
public abstract class MEMEToolkit
extends SwingToolkit
implements MEMEConstants

Utility class that has generic methods that the server/client can use. All of the methods of the toolkit are static which means that the toolkit should never be directly instantiated. Instead, it has initialize methods that initialize a set of internal properties and a log. Applications using the toolkit should pass in a set of application specific allowed and required properties.

Author:
MEME Group

Constructor Detail

MEMEToolkit

public MEMEToolkit()
Method Detail

initialize

public static void initialize(String[] app_specific_properties,
                              String[] app_specific_req_props)
                       throws InitializationException
Initialize the toolkit properties and log. The toolkit is not directly constructed, instead all of its methods are accessed in a static way, so it must be initialized. This calls initializeProperties(String,String[],String[]) and passes it the property file name specified in MEMEConstants.PROPERTIES_FILE, then it initializes the log from the MEMEConstants.LOG_FILE property. This initialize method loads properties, especially a whole property file, over the command line and sets the properties of the application if their keys are included in app_specific_properties or MEMEConstants.ALLOWABLE_PROPERTIES. It sets the PrintWriter to STDOUT unless the log file property is set.

Parameters:
app_specific_properties - A String[] containing application specific property names to initialize
app_specific_req_props - A String[] containing application specific require properties
Throws:
InitializationException - if initialization failed.

Initialize the toolkit properties and log. The toolkit is not directly constructed, instead all of its methods are accessed in a static way, so it must be initialized. This calls initializeProperties(Properties,String[],String[]). This sets the properties of the application if their keys are included in app_specific_properties or MEMEConstants.ALLOWABLE_PROPERTIES. It sets the PrintWriter to STDOUT unless the log file property is set.

initializeProperties

public static void initializeProperties(String properties_file,
                                        String[] app_specific_properties,
                                        String[] app_specific_req_props)
                                 throws InitializationException
Initializes properties mentioned in MEMEConstants.ALLOWABLE_PROPERTIES, in the array app_specific_prop, and any system properties starting with meme.app. Checks afterwards if the required properties in MEMEConstants.REQUIRED_PROPERTIES and in the array app_specific_req_props are set, Exits otherwise.

Parameters:
properties_file - the name of a valid java properties file
app_specific_properties - a String[] containing application specific property names to initialize
app_specific_req_props - a String[] containing application specific require properties
Throws:
InitializationException - if failed to initialize properties

initializeLog

public static void initializeLog()
Initializes the internal PrintWriter representing the log. If the log file already exists, the user is asked if (s)he wishes to overwrite it. If the specified logfile is null or "" then log to STDOUT. To specify an actual log file set the MEMEConstants.MEME_HOME property to the $MEME_HOME directory, and then set the MEMEConstants.LOG_FILE property to a relative path to the desired log file, where the path is relative to $MEME_HOME.

setLog

public static void setLog(PrintWriter newlog)
Sets the log to the specified PrintWriter.

Parameters:
newlog - a PrintWriter for the new log

logComment

public static void logComment(String comment,
                              boolean print_date)
Writes specified comment to the log and (optionally) prepends the current date. If the comment is multi-line, the date is prepended at the beginning of each of the lines.

Parameters:
comment - the comment
print_date - a flag indicating whether or not to prepend the date

logStartTime

public static void logStartTime(String key)
Hashes the current time using the specified key, and writes a comment to the log. Generally, this method is used in conjunction with logElapsedTime(String).

Parameters:
key - the name of an operation whose elapsed time is to be measured

logElapsedTime

public static void logElapsedTime(String key)
Writes the elapsed time of an operation to the log. This should be used in conjunction with logStartTime(String) to write both the start and elapsed times of an operation to the log. Do NOT call this method without first establishing a start time.

Parameters:
key - the name of an operation whose elapsed time is to be measured

getElapsedTime

public static String getElapsedTime(String key)
Returns the elapsed time for an operation as a String. This method is much like logElapsedTime(String) except that the elapsed time is returned instead of written to the log.

Parameters:
key - the name of an operation whose elapsed time is to be measured
Returns:
a String representation of the elapsed time

exec

public static String exec(String[] cmdarray,
                          String[] env,
                          boolean write_to_log,
                          int write_mode,
                          boolean background)
                   throws ExecException
Executes an operating system command with more options. This is the most flexible (and confusing) of the exec methods.

It allows you to specify a command with parameters and a set of environment variable definitions. You may determine whether or not the process should write to the application log, and if it does whether it reads the processes STDOUT or STDERR. Finally, you can choose to run the process in the background.

Parameters:
cmdarray - a String[] where the first element is the command and remaining elements are arguments
env - a String[] containing "NAME=VALUE" pairs of environment variable definitions
write_to_log - a flag indicating whether or not this process should write to the server log
write_mode - an int representing whether to connect to the process STDOUT or STDERR. -1 can be passed to connect to neither
background - a flag indicating whether or not to run the process in the background. It is recommended that if you set this to true then you should also set write_mode to MEMEConstants.USE_NO_STREAM
Returns:
a String containing the process log
Throws:
ExecException - if failed to execute command

exec

public static String exec(String[] cmdarray,
                          String[] env,
                          boolean write_to_log,
                          int write_mode,
                          boolean background,
                          File dir)
                   throws ExecException
Executes an operating system command with more options. This is the most flexible (and confusing) of the exec methods.

It allows you to specify a command with parameters and a set of environment variable definitions. You may determine whether or not the process should write to the application log, and if it does whether it reads the processes STDOUT or STDERR. Finally, you can choose to run the process in the background.

Parameters:
cmdarray - a String[] where the first element is the command and remaining elements are arguments
env - a String[] containing "NAME=VALUE" pairs of environment variable definitions
write_to_log - a flag indicating whether or not this process should write to the server log
write_mode - an int representing whether to connect to the process STDOUT or STDERR. -1 can be passed to connect to neither
background - a flag indicating whether or not to run the process in the background. It is recommended that if you set this to true then you should also set write_mode to MEMEConstants.USE_NO_STREAM
dir - the working directory of the subprocess
Returns:
a String containing the process log
Throws:
ExecException - if failed to execute command

                          boolean background,

                   throws ExecException
Executes an operating system command with more options. This is the most flexible (and confusing) of the exec methods.

It allows you to specify a command with parameters and a set of environment variable definitions. You may determine whether or not the process should write to the application log, and if it does whether it reads the processes STDOUT or STDERR. Finally, you can choose to run the process in the background.

Parameters:
cmdarray - a String[] where the first element is the command and remaining elements are arguments
env - a String[] containing "NAME=VALUE" pairs of environment variable definitions
write_to_log - a flag indicating whether or not this process should write to the server log
write_mode - an int representing whether to connect to the process STDOUT or STDERR. -1 can be passed to connect to neither
background - a flag indicating whether or not to run the process in the background. It is recommended that if you set this to true then you should also set write_mode to MEMEConstants.USE_NO_STREAM
dir - the working directory of the subprocess

Throws:

handleError

public static void handleError(Exception e)
Handle an exception. Here we wrap the generic exception into a MEMEException wrapper and send it to be processed again.

Parameters:
e - an Exception

handleError

public static void handleError(MEMEException me)
Handle a MEMEException. This method does a series of things based on the configuration of the exception. It does the following things:
  1. Write the stack trace to the application log
  2. Inform the user (optionally)
  3. Inform the administrator via email (optionally)
  4. Add the exception to the statistics tracking
  5. Exit the application if fatal (optionally)
Whether or not these things are done depends upon the configuration of the exception object itself.

Parameters:
me - a MEMEException

splitString

public static String[] splitString(String to_split,
                                   int line_length)
Splits a string on word boundaries so that each element of the string array returned represents a "line" of the original string that is no longer than the specified max line length. This is very useful for breaking up long strings into 80 character chunks for displaying in a " terminal.

Parameters:
to_split - the String to split up
line_length - the maximum line length, or -1 to accept the default setting.
Returns:
a String[] of the lines

sort

public static void sort(String filename)
                 throws MEMEException
Sort the specified file using a UNIX sort command. This should really be moved elsewhere.

Parameters:
filename - the file to sort
Throws:
MEMEException - if failed to sort.
